content: Ups and downs for me. I’m so close to my e-fund goal, but had some medical expenses this month that will knock it down a bit in March. For the first time ever though, I didn’t have to charge those expenses to a credit card. Even if my overall liquid net worth hasn’t changed much, I feel like I’m slowly breaking the cycle of consumer debt habits… Emergency Fund (Goal: $10k)January — $8,000February — $9,100 Vacation Fund (Goal: $2k)January — $0February — $0 Vanguard 401k (Goal: 10% per paycheck)January — $48,926February — $51,090 Credit Card Debt January — $8,119February — $6,873 Now I’m just waiting on that sweet tax return to hit so I can keep paying down debt and start funding this year’s wedding travel. Those bridesmaids dresses won’t buy themselves.
